moves.3... Nf6: The Berlin!Many people don't like it because they say it's drawish.I like it because it will usually get me into the endgame where I am very comfortable.
moves.7. Nxe5: White deviates.The main line is 7.dxe5 Nf5 8.Qxd8+ Kxd8 9.Nc3 where Black has 9...Ke8 9...h6 or 9...Ne7!?.White has a slight edge because of Black's king,but Black's two bishops give him compensation.
moves.7... Be7 8. Qh5: ?!This move does absolutely nothing and the queen can be driven back.
moves.8... g6 9. Qe2 Bf5: Black's position is solid except for the weak dark squares on the kingside.
moves.10. b3 f6: Kicking the knight from it's strong post.
moves.11. Nc4 Nxc4 12. Qxc4: Black may not be able to castle for the moment,but his king is safe.
moves.13. Qe2: 13.Qxd5 cxd5 and Black has at least equality,even a slight advantage.Black has to two Bishops,straightened out his pawns and is ahead in development.
moves.14. Nc3: ? loses a pawn with the trade of queens!
moves.19. Re1+ Kd7: Black's king is well placed and the e-file will be contested.
moves.24. Ra1 Rc2 25. Rxa3 Rxc3 26. Nc5+: ?? White is lost anyway,but this gives him no hope.
moves.26... Rxc5: ! if 27.dxc5?? Re1# due to White's weak back rank.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C67), open Berlin defence, l'Hermet variation
